item.title: Research software engineer Vineet Bansal will work with the lab
item.description: Vineet Bansal is a Senior Research Software Engineer at the Center for Statistics and Machine Learning. He will contribute to a number of projects in the lab.

item.title: Dimitar Chakarov joins the lab as an undergraduate researcher
item.description: We are happy to welcome an undergraduate student Dimitar Chakarov pursuing math and computer science studies at Princeton. He will join us as an Undergraduate Research Asssistant.

item.title: Yuri receives NIAID DP2 New Innovator Award!
item.description: Yuri receives the DP2 New Innovator Award from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases! We will use these funds to continue studying regulatory genomics of T cells in mouse and human across contexts in a data-driven manner.

item.title: Yuri participates in the Irving Cancer Immunology Symposium in Boston
item.description: Yuri participates in the second annual Arthur and Sandra Irving Cancer Immunology Symposium.

item.title: Yuri organized Special session on computational immunology at ISMB 2022
item.description: Yuri organized Special session on Computational Immunology at ISMB 2022, the premier international conference on computational biology and bioinformatics, which happened this year in Madison, Wisconsin.

item.title: Dr. Zhengqiao Zhao joins the lab as a postdoc
Congratulations to Amanda and Gabe on their Honorable Mention for the NSF GRFP applications
item.description: Amanda and Gabe received Honorable Mention for their applications for National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program. Congratulations!

item.title: Congratulations to Amanda, Gabe and Sarah on passing their general exam
item.description: Our QCB students Amanda Sun, Gabe Dolsten and Sarah Walker successfully passed their general (qualifying) exam. Congratulations!

item.title: Pritykin lab receives funding from the Ludwig Princeton Branch
item.description: Pritykin lab receives funding from the Princeton Branch of the Ludwig Institute for Cancer Research to work on metabolic analysis in T cells via computational genomics.

item.title: New Pritykin Lab website is launched
item.description: New website of the Pritykin lab is launched at pritykinlab.github.io.

item.title: Dr. Ian Traniello joins the lab as LSI Scholar
Pritykin lab receives funding from Princeton Biomolecular Condensate Program with the Levine lab
Three QCB students, Amanda Sun, Sarah Walker and Gabe Dolsten, join the lab
Pritykin Lab receives New Investigator Award from Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey
Our paper "A unified atlas of CD8 T cell dysfunctional states in cancer and infection" appears online at Molecular Cell
Pritykin Lab is now open!
item.description: The Pritykin lab at the Lewis-Sigler Institute for Integrative Genomics opens its doors!
